actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to H. Res. 1427. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on September 10, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Jackson (TX) moved that the House do now adjourn.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6614.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6614 — "To amend the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 relating to licensing transparency."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7089.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7089 — "To authorize the Diplomatic Security Services of the Department of State to investigate allegations of violations of conduct constituting offenses under chapter 77 of title 18, United States Code, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1608.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1608 — "To provide for the expansion of the Starr-Camargo Bridge near Rio Grande City, Texas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7159.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7159 — "To bolster United States engagement with the Pacific Islands region, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4741.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 4741 — "To require the development of a strategy to promote the use of secure telecommunications infrastructure worldwide, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1056.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 1056 — "Recognizing the importance of trilateral cooperation among the United States, Japan, and South Korea."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6606.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Radewagen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6606 — "To amend the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 relating to the statement of policy."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7151.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7151 — "To amend the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 to provide for expedited consideration of proposals for additions to, removals from, or other modifications with respect to entities on the Entity List, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1427 — "Expressing the profound sorrow of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable William J. Pascrell, Jr."

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to the threat of foreign interference in or undermining public confidence in United States elections declared in Executive Order 13848 of September 12, 2018, is to continue in effect beyond September 12, 2024.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committees on Foreign Affairs, Judiciary, Intelligence, and House Administration and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-165).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the emergency declared in Proclamation 7463 with respect to the terrorist attacks on the United States of September 11, 2001, is to continue in effect for an additional year.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-164).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 306
actions-list.actionItem: 81 (Roll no. 402).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8333 — "To prohibit contracting with certain biotechnology providers, and for other purposes."
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Honorable Bill Pascrell, Jr.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 351
actions-list.actionItem: 36 (Roll no. 401).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1157 — "To provide for the authorization of appropriations for the Countering the People's Republic of China Malign Influence Fund, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7701.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7701 — "To require the imposition of sanctions with respect to any foreign person that knowingly participates in the construction, maintenance, or repair of a tunnel or bridge that connects the Russian mainland with the Crimean peninsula."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8152.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8152 — "To amend the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 to provide for control of remote access of items, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5613.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5613 — "To require a review of whether individuals or entities subject to the imposition of certain sanctions through inclusion on certain sanctions lists should also be subject to the imposition of other sanctions and included on other sanctions lists."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5245.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5245 — "To amend the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 to require certain congressional notification prior to entering into, renewing, or extending a science and technology agreement with the People's Republic of China, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8361.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8361 — "To impose sanctions with respect to economic or industrial espionage by foreign adversarial companies, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1103.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1103 — "To require the President to remove the extension of certain privileges, exemptions, and immunities to the Hong Kong Economic and Trade Offices if Hong Kong no longer enjoys a high degree of autonomy from the People's Republic of China, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1157.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barr moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1157 — "To provide for the authorization of appropriations for the Countering the People's Republic of China Malign Influence Fund, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7404.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Gimenez moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7404 — "To require annual reports on counter illicit cross-border tunnel operations, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8663.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gimenez moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8663 — "To require the Science and Technology Directorate in the Department of Homeland Security to develop greater capacity to detect, identify, and disrupt illicit substances in very low concentrations."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8631.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gimenez moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8631 — "To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from procuring certain foreign-made batteries, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7589.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7589 — "To direct the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information, to conduct a study of the national security risks posed by consumer routers, modems, and devices that combine a modem and router, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 820.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 820 — "To direct the Federal Communications Commission to publish a list of entities that hold authorizations, licenses, or other grants of authority issued by the Commission and that have certain foreign ownership, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2864.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2864 — "To amend the Secure and Trusted Communications Networks Act of 2019 to provide for the addition of certain equipment and services produced or provided by DJI Technologies to the list of covered communications equipment or services published under such Act, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8333.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8333 — "To prohibit contracting with certain biotechnology providers, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6513.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6513 — "To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to confirm the requirement that States allow access to designated congressional election observers to observe the election administration procedures in congressional elections."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7593.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7593 — "To enhance the authority of the Director of the Congressional Research Service to obtain information directly from agencies of the Federal government."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7592.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7592 — "To direct the Librarian of Congress to promote the more cost-effective, efficient, and expanded availability of the Annotated Constitution and pocket-part supplements by replacing the hardbound versions with digital versions."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 554.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 554 — "To deter Chinese aggression towards Taiwan by requiring the Secretary of the Treasury to publish a report on financial institutions and accounts connected to senior officials of the People's Republic of China, to restrict financial services for certain immediate family of such officials, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 510.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 510 — "To require the United States Governor of, and the United States Executive Director at, the International Monetary Fund to oppose an increase in the weight of the Chinese renminbi in the Special Drawing Rights basket of the Fund, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7686.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Lucas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7686 — "To amend the Research and Development, Competition, and Innovation Act to clarify the definition of foreign country for purposes of malign foreign talent recruitment restriction, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Glenn Thompson to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
